channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubber pulled off the swing handles, 9th November
item.description:
Two swings have had the rubber pulled off them. I cut open my hand touching one. It is currently dangerous for young children.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Spring Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Overflowing bin has still not been collected, 9th November
item.description:
You closed the previous report 8377866 in error without collecting our rubbish bin. As that report stated we have not had regular bin collections in a month. Please do not close again without confirming that you intend to correct this situation.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large number of fallen leaves, 9th November
item.description:
An elderly resident complained about the large number of fallen leaves outside her house and how it was slippery and dangerous to go outside given her mobility issues.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reighton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes chained on disabled pole, 9th November
item.description:
Hi I am finding it more and more difficult to get in and out of my vehicle parked outside my house in a disabled bay.as I am disabled and need access to open my car doors. Recently there has been a bike and many lime bikes parking outside my house which has a disabled bay outside. One of the bikes is always locked on the pole which makes it impossible to open the car door. Please can somebody help me. As it is causing a great deal of stress to me. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bracey Street, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Improper parking blocking access to disabled and public, 9th November
item.description:
I am writing to express my concern regarding persistent issues with improper parking in front of the disabled bay. This recurring problem consistently obstructs access for the public and, more importantly, for my disabled father. The current situation poses a significant barrier to essential services and accessibility for those who rely on this designated parking area. I have observed vehicles repeatedly disregarding the purpose and importance of this space. This creates considerable inconvenience and frustration for individuals with mobility challenges. I urge you to consider implementing measures to ensure this vital access remains clear. Addressing this issue would greatly improve the experience for all users. Bikes registration: BQM- ATH

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Corbyn Street, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
